ticket.title: Namespace and Custom routes
ticket.original-body:
Given the following routes
@@@ ruby namespace :admin do root :to => "dashboard#index" end @@@
the rake routes return admin_root /admin(.:format) {:controller=>"admin/dashboard", :action=>"index"}
the Admin::DashbordController has only the index method.
when I go to localhost:3000/admin I'm getting 'uninitialized constant Dashboard'
I've tried to use match 'admin' => "admin/dashboard#index" getting the same error message...
I'm running rails 3.0.6
ticket.latest-body:
Given the following routes
@@@ ruby namespace :admin do root :to => "dashboard#index" end @@@
the rake routes return admin_root /admin(.:format) {:controller=>"admin/dashboard", :action=>"index"}
the Admin::DashbordController has only the index method.
when I go to localhost:3000/admin I'm getting 'uninitialized constant Dashboard'
I've tried to use match 'admin' => "admin/dashboard#index" getting the same error message...
I'm running rails 3.0.6
ticket.original-body-html:
Given the following routes

  namespace :admin do
    root :to => "dashboard#index"
  end

the rake routes return
admin_root /admin(.:format) {:controller=>"admin/dashboard", :action=>"index"}

the Admin::DashbordController has only the index method.

when I go to localhost:3000/admin I'm getting 'uninitialized constant Dashboard'

I've tried to use match 'admin' => "admin/dashboard#index" getting the same error message...

I'm running rails 3.0.6

@@@ ruby namespace :admin do root :to => "dashboard#index" end @@@
the rake routes return admin_root /admin(.:format) {:controller=>"admin/dashboard", :action=>"index"}
the Admin::DashbordController has only the index method.

Given the following routes

  namespace :admin do
    root :to => "dashboard#index"
  end

the rake routes return
admin_root /admin(.:format) {:controller=>"admin/dashboard", :action=>"index"}

the Admin::DashbordController has only the index method.

when I go to localhost:3000/admin I'm getting 'uninitialized constant Dashboard'

I've tried to use match 'admin' => "admin/dashboard#index" getting the same error message...

I'm running rails 3.0.6
version.title: Namespace and Custom routes

version.body: Works in a brand new 3.0.6 app for me - are you sure your controller names are correct?
version.body-html: Works in a brand new 3.0.6 app for me - are you sure your controller names are correct?
version.title: Namespace and Custom routes

version.body:
Andrew, I think the name is ok
take a look (it's inside app/controllers/admin
file name dashboard_controller.rb @@@ ruby class Admin::DashboardController < Admin::AdminController load_and_authorize_resource def index end end @@@
and the Admin::AdminController (admin_controller.rb)
@@@ ruby class Admin::AdminController < ApplicationController layout 'admin' before_filter :authenticate_user! end @@@
best regards Rafael
version.body-html:
Andrew, I think the name is ok

take a look (it's inside app/controllers/admin

file name dashboard_controller.rb

  class Admin::DashboardController < Admin::AdminController
    load_and_authorize_resource
    def index
    end
  end

and the Admin::AdminController (admin_controller.rb)

  class Admin::AdminController < ApplicationController
    layout 'admin'
    before_filter :authenticate_user!
  end

best regards
Rafael
version.title: Namespace and Custom routes

version.body: Do you have an Admin::Dashboard model?
version.title: Namespace and Custom routes

version.body:
No, I don't have any
I don't know if it helps, but the authentication is provided by devise, and the load_and_authorize_resource is from CanCan
version.body-html:
No, I don't have any

I don't know if it helps, but the authentication is provided by devise, and the load_and_authorize_resource is from CanCan
version.title: Namespace and Custom routes

version.title: Namespace and Custom routes

version.body: Your problem is CanCan - it's trying to authorise the Dashboard resource which doesn't exist
version.body-html: Your problem is CanCan - it's trying to authorise the Dashboard resource which doesn't exist
version.title: Namespace and Custom routes
